title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is expected to play in the Super Bowl without injury limitations.
Linebackers Harold Landry and Robert Spillane are questionable for New England's game against the Seahawks.
Rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is questionable, while Seattle's fullback Robbie Ouzts has an injury designation.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Hell or High Water' featuring Chris Pine and Ben Foster is now streaming on Netflix.
'Splitsville', a comedic film starring Kyle Marvin and Dakota Johnson, is available on Hulu.
A revival of 'The Muppet Show' is streaming on Disney+, featuring music by Sabrina Carpenter.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs's phrase 'we all we got, we all we need' motivates the Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX.
The rallying cry helped the Patriots turn their season around, winning 15 of their last 16 games.
Diggs, facing assault charges, remains a vocal leader, supporting the team's success and cohesion.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris, 34, from North Attleboro, is running her first Boston Marathon to support Massachusetts General Hospital.
Demeris's fundraising supports Emergency Response, Cancer Care & Research, and the Home Base Program at Mass. General Hospital.
She is motivated by personal connections: her friend works in emergency care and her husband and mother have health-related ties.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets' South End location will close in June after 28 years due to costly necessary updates and business challenges.
Neighborhood objections redirected The Croft School from expanding into the space, initially considered after Foodie's announced its closure.
Residents launched a petition against losing essential retail space, gathering over 1,500 signatures opposing non-retail use of the site.

title: The anonymous Drake Maye Lover Instagram account has developed quite the following
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: The @DrakeMayeLover Instagram account was created in May 2024 and now has nearly 400,000 followers.
The account, dedicated to Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, posts memes and has its own merchandise line.
The creator may reveal his identity if he meets Drake Maye, remaining anonymous despite multiple interview requests.

title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady's neutrality on the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl clash disappoints some New England Patriots fans.
Nearly 700 Boston.com readers share mixed reactions to Brady's neutral stance, ranging from disappointment to understanding.
Brady, now linked to the Raiders and media, underscores a new chapter; fans express varied opinions on his stance.

title: Carlton Davis shares how Patriots will cover Offensive Player of the Year Jaxon Smith-Njigba in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will cover Seahawks' Jaxon Smith-Njigba in Super Bowl LX, according to Carlton Davis.
Smith-Njigba led the NFL with 1,793 receiving yards and 10 touchdowns this season, winning Offensive Player of the Year.
Gonzalez allowed 35 receptions for 357 yards in the regular season, earning a Pro Bowl selection.

title: How Hopkintonâ€™s theater community inspired one woman to run the Boston Marathon
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Carla Perrotta, 45, is fundraising for the Hopkinton Center for the Arts by running the 2026 Boston Marathon.
Perrotta moved to the Boston area in 2016 and connected with the community through the Enter Stage Left theater.
She previously completed the Boston Marathon in 2018 and feels a continued urgency to support the arts in 2026.

title: Newton Jewish day school places teacher on leave amid investigation into alleged inappropriate touching
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Solomon Schechter Day School in Newton placed a teacher on leave after a student reported inappropriate contact.
The student, who tested positive for an STI, alleged inappropriate touching by the teacher, triggering multiple investigations.
Massachusetts authorities, including Newton Police and Middlesex DA, are investigating; no criminal charges have been filed yet.
